story.text: Here we record the steps taken to go from nothing* to a statically published wiki site. We're writing these notes as we take each few steps as a way to discover the actual complexity of the process.
* nothing is an exaggeration. We did start within a fully-formed universe. We also make a few parenthetical notes along the way when we notice other prerequisites.
# Created a Local Wiki
Visited [http://mud.localhost http://mud.localhost].
(Reveals that I already have an operational local farm.)
Found my way to [[About Flagmatic Plugin]].
Chose a muddy sort of flag for this site.
Dragged Ward's page to my browser tab and claimed a copy of my own.
story.title: Muddy Thinking

story.text: Added the page about me so other participants can discover which parts of this exploration I contribute.
# Created a Folder for Git
Did a few things in iTerm. 1) create a folder where I'll manage a git repository. 2) use wiki-ssg to generate a static site from mud.localhost.

mkdir ~/workspace/dobbs/mud.dbbs.co  #chose a domain name
cd ~/workspace/dobbs/mud.dbbs.co
npx wiki-ssg build --from ~/.wiki/mud.localhost \
  --dest .
git init .
git add .
git commit -am "begin the mud wrestling"
# Created a New GitHub Repo
via [https://github.com/new https://github.com/new]
(Reveals that I already have an account on github:  [https://github.com/dobbs https://github.com/dobbs])
Named the repo to match the name I've chosen.
Copied some lines from github to connect my local folder:

git remote add origin \
    git@github.com:dobbs/mud.dbbs.co.git
git branch -M main
git push -u origin main
# Created a DNS Record
Visited digital ocean to create a CNAME record for the new wiki: [https://cloud.digitalocean.com https://cloud.digitalocean.com]
mud.dbbs.co.   1800   IN   CNAME   dobbs.github.io.

(Reveals that I already lease the dbbs.co domain name, that I manage that name with digital ocean, that I know how to use their DNS forms, and that I know github's naming conventions and support for custom addresses by creating a CNAME to dobbs.github.io)
# Configured GitHub Pages
Setup pages in the github repo: [https://github.com/dobbs/mud.dbbs.co/settings/pages https://github.com/dobbs/mud.dbbs.co/settings/pages]

Changed the source to use the main branch and saved. Then watched the github action in action: [https://github.com/dobbs/mud.dbbs.co/actions/runs/1795661118 https://github.com/dobbs/mud.dbbs.co/actions/runs/1795661118]

When that build was complete, I returned to the pages settings: [https://github.com/dobbs/mud.dbbs.co/settings/pages https://github.com/dobbs/mud.dbbs.co/settings/pages] to configure the custom domain name.
I watched github build and deploy that change: [https://github.com/dobbs/mud.dbbs.co/actions/runs/1795678827 https://github.com/dobbs/mud.dbbs.co/actions/runs/1795678827]
Then visited the site myself to confirm success. [http://mud.dbbs.co mud.dbbs.co]
# Synced Local Repo with GitHub
When I configured the CNAME in GitHub, a commit was added to the repo up in the cloud. I needed to synchronize the local repo with that change.
git pull
